summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618). The emails detail multiple trips planned between March 2019 and February 2020 to conduct witness and victim interviews in locations including West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, Los Angeles, Stockholm, and Pensacola.

They are repeatedly mentioned as traveling together as part of the same investigation team to conduct interviews.

keyFacts: The document reveals active federal investigation (case 2018R01618) into Jeffrey Epstein for enticement of minors was ongoing from at least March 2019 through February 2020.
The investigation involved extensive travel by a USAO SDNY team to conduct witness and victim interviews in multiple U.S. cities and internationally in Sweden.
The team frequently requested hotel conference rooms to conduct interviews, indicating formal, recorded proceedings.
The international trip to Sweden in January 2020 suggests the investigation had a witness or evidence located outside the United States.
The correspondence shows a standardized process for seeking and obtaining travel approvals within the USAO for this high-profile investigation.
